clinical_study.brief_title: Safety of Hormonal Contraceptives Therapies in Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS) Women
clinical_study.official_title: Metabolic Effects of Multiple Therapies in Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS) Women

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study to assess early markers of cardiovascular disease in women with polycystic ovary syndrome in use of oral contraceptive containing ethynilestradiol and chlormadinone acetate alone or associated with Spironolactone.

detailed_description.textblock: Polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS) is associated with comorbidities that may contribute to increased risk of cardiovascular disease (CVD). Oral contraceptives (OC) have been the mainstay of PCOS pharmacological therapy for decades. However, in non-hyperandrogenic women, OC use is associated with higher risk of cardiovascular disease, raising concern about a possible worsening of the unfavorable metabolic and cardiovascular profile of PCOS patients. There is lack of evidence about the impact of PCOS pharmacological therapies on cardiovascular risk markers and the long-term safety of these drugs in PCOS has not been established. The aim of this study is to compare the effect of an OC alone or associated with an anti-androgenic drug (spironolactone) on echografic cardiovascular risk markers, metabolic and hemostatic variables.

primary_outcome.measure: To compare the effect of an oral contraceptive alone or associated with an anti-androgenic drug (spironolactone) or associated with metformin on echografic cardiovascular risk markers.

secondary_outcome.measure: to compare the effect of an oral contraceptive alone or associated with an anti-androgenic drug (spironolactone) or associated with metformin on seric cardiovascular risk markers.
to compare the effect of an oral contraceptive alone or associated with an anti-androgenic drug (spironolactone) or associated with metformin on hemostatic variables.
to compare the effect of an oral contraceptive alone or associated with an anti-androgenic drug (spironolactone) or associated with metformin on metabolic variables.

arm_group.description: This group will receive an oral contraceptive containing 0,03mg ethynylestradiol and 2mg chlormadinone acetate
The patient will receive an oral contraceptive (0,03mg ethynylestradiol and 2mg chlormadinone acetate) plus 100 mg spironolactone. One pill each once a day for twelve months.
The patient will receive an oral contraceptive (0,03mg ethynylestradiol and 2mg chlormadinone acetate) plus 850 mg metformin.
